name: Foundation of Lindon and Grey Havens
description: The Elves found the kingdom of Lindon under Gil-galad as well as the Grey Havens.

name: Elros appointed ruler of Númenor
description: The Valar appoint Elros as the first ruler of the newly founded island realm of Númenor, but forbid his people to come to Aman.

name: Vardamir succeeds Elros
description: After Elros' death, Vardamir becomes his successor as King of Númenor, but he immediately abdicates in favor of his son Tar-Amandil.

name: Tar-Elendil becomes King
description: Tar-Amandil passes the Sceptre of Númenor to his son Tar-Elendil.

name: First Númenórean visit to Middle-earth
description: For the first time Númenóreans visit Middle-earth, where they make friendship with Gil-galad.

name: Tar-Meneldur becomes King
description: Tar-Meneldur follows his father Tar-Elendil on the throne of Númenor.

name: Foundation of Eregion
description: The Elves found Eregion.

name: Tar-Aldarion becomes King
description: Tar-Meneldur leaves the sceptre of Númenor to his son Tar-Aldarion.

name: Sauron establishes Mordor
description: Sauron retreats to the east of Middle-earth and establishes his realm Mordor.

name: Tar-Ancalime becomes first Ruling Queen
description: Tar-Ancalime, daughter of Tar-Aldarion, becomes the first Ruling Queen of Númenor.

name: Sauron deceives the Elves of Eregion
description: Sauron wins the trust of the Elves of Eregion unrecognized and instructs their smiths. The Númenóreans establish their own harbors on the west coast of Middle-earth.

name: Tar-Anárion becomes King
description: Tar-Ancalime abdicates and leaves the rule over Númenor to her son Tar-Anárion.

name: Tar-Súrion becomes King
description: After his elder sisters have renounced their claim to the throne, Tar-Súrion becomes successor to his father Tar-Anárion as King of Númenor.

name: Beginning of Ring-forging
description: The Elves begin to forge Rings of Power.

name: Tar-Telperien becomes second Ruling Queen
description: Tar-Telperien takes over the sceptre of Númenor from her father Tar-Súrion and thus becomes the second Ruling Queen of the island.

name: Creation of the One Ring
description: Sauron creates the One Ring. After ca. 600 years of construction time, his fortress Barad-dûr is completed.

name: War against the Elves of Eriador
description: Sauron wages war against the Elves of Eriador and is finally defeated with the help of the Númenóreans.

name: Foundation of Imladris
description: After the destruction of Eregion, Elrond founds Imladris.

name: Tar-Minastir becomes King
description: Tar-Minastir follows his childless aunt Tar-Telperiën on the throne of Númenor.

name: Númenórean expansion
description: The Númenóreans begin to found their own realms on the west coast of Middle-earth. Sauron thereupon extends his sphere of influence towards the east.

name: Tar-Ciryatan becomes King
description: Tar-Ciryatan becomes King of Númenor as successor to his father Tar-Minastir.

name: Tar-Atanamir becomes King
description: Tar-Atanamir takes over the throne of Númenor from his father Tar-Ciryatan. He speaks openly against the Ban of the Valar, a shadow falls on Númenor.

name: Tar-Ancalimon becomes King and first Nazgûl appear
description: After the death of his father Tar-Atanamir, Tar-Ancalimon becomes King of Númenor. The people are split into supporters and opponents of the Valar. The Nazgûl are noticed for the first time.

name: Tar-Telemmaite becomes King
description: Tar-Telemmaite takes over after the death of his father Tar-Ancalimon the sceptre of Númenor.

name: Tar-Vanimelde becomes third Ruling Queen
description: Tar-Vanimelde becomes the third Ruling Queen of Númenor after the death of her father Tar-Telemmaite, but leaves the business of government largely to her husband Herucalmo.

name: Herucalmo usurps the throne
description: After the death of his wife Tar-Vanimelde, Herucalmo withholds the sceptre of Númenor from her son and rightful heir Alcarin and ascends the throne himself under the name Tar-Anducal.

name: Tar-Alcarin becomes King
description: Tar-Alcarin becomes King of Númenor after his father Tar-Anducal has died.

name: Tar-Calmacil becomes King
description: The King of Númenor, Tar-Alcarin, dies. His son Tar-Calmacil becomes his successor.

name: Tar-Ardamin becomes King
description: Tar-Ardamin becomes King of Númenor after the death of his father Tar-Calmacil.

name: First Adûnaic King name
description: After the death of Tar-Calmacil, with his son Ar-Adûnakhôr for the first time a king ascends the throne under an Adûnaic name.

name: Ar-Zimrathôn becomes King
description: Ar-Zimrathôn takes over the sceptre of Númenor from his father Ar-Adûnakhôr.

name: Ar-Sakalthôr becomes King
description: Ar-Sakalthôr follows his father Ar-Zimrathôn on the throne of Númenor.

name: Ar-Gimilzôr becomes King
description: Ar-Zimrathôn dies. New King of Númenor becomes his son Ar-Gimilzôr.

name: Tar-Palantir becomes King
description: Tar-Palantir becomes the 24th ruler of Númenor as successor to his father Ar-Gimilzôr. He returns to the former veneration of the Valar. Civil war breaks out.

name: Ar-Pharazôn becomes King
description: After the death of Tar-Palantir, Ar-Pharazôn forces the heir to the throne, his cousin Míriel, to marry him and thus becomes King of Númenor.

name: Sauron brought to Númenor
description: Ar-Pharazôn takes Sauron prisoner and has him brought to Númenor.

name: Downfall of Númenor
description: The King of Númenor attacks Valinor. Ilúvatar performs the Changing of the World and destroys Númenor.

name: Foundation of Arnor and Gondor
description: Elendil and his sons, who were able to escape the downfall of Númenor, establish in Middle-earth the kingdoms of Arnor and Gondor.

name: Sauron attacks Gondor
description: Sauron attacks Gondor.

name: Formation of the Last Alliance
description: Men and Elves form the Last Alliance to fight together against Sauron.

name: Battle of Dagorlad and Siege of Barad-dûr
description: Elendil and Gil-galad defeat Sauron's troops in the Battle of Dagorlad and begin the Siege of Barad-dûr.

name: End of the Second Age
description: Elendil and Gil-galad cast down Sauron and perish in the process. Isildur takes the One Ring to himself.
